text: news flash if you trade or invest you're going to lose we all lose the point though is that you don't want to lose in the aggregate you want to lose in individual circumstances so that you can get smarter about your strategy and thus make more money if you get into this investing and trading world with the idea of never losing any money you're not going to make any money so in the video today I want to walk us through an example on what this can look like pretty frequently and then most importantly at the end of the video I'm gonna walk you through exactly how to maximize your losing trades because there is an opportunity in every single one of them if you know where to look what's up everybody Eric here welcome back to all the outliers and if what I do helps you in any way consider signing up for the patreon I really appreciate your guys's support okay let's get to it how to maximize losing trades so here we have a post from options I purposefully went to the options subreddit versus Wall Street bets or something like that because people on Wall Street bets they're just slinging money fun coupons yeah hoping that something works and what I mean by that is you're not really getting a great sense of people who are attempting to manage risk and make money you're just seeing people who are trying to hit the

text: on Wall Street bets they're just slinging money fun coupons yeah hoping that something works and what I mean by that is you're not really getting a great sense of people who are attempting to manage risk and make money you're just seeing people who are trying to hit the lottery oh my God jackpot baby so I'm calling that from the group in its entirety and we're focusing on people who think they're trying to make money in a sophisticated manner yep options trading so with that I want to highlight a few things from this excerpt and what you can learn from this person so that you don't have to make the same exact mistakes if in life but trading specifically you are one of those people that has to touch the stove in order to realize it's hot if you say oh I only learned from my personal experience you're not gonna make any money in this business there is too steep of a learning curve to be that ignorant to not be able to learn from other people's mistakes and successes so get rid of that right out of the gate let's learn from a mistake so this week might be the end for now to my trading career I have t triple Q calls that expire this week we Dove hard at the moment I'm still holding on to them to salvage what I can but I've essentially hit about four hundred dollars left in

text: so this week might be the end for now to my trading career I have t triple Q calls that expire this week we Dove hard at the moment I'm still holding on to them to salvage what I can but I've essentially hit about four hundred dollars left in my account so let's see what this person has done to put into context I've been trading for almost a year that's the first thing that keys out to me almost a year that's a very short duration starting in September of 2019 I had plenty of success going up and even success on the way down after the coveted crash in March I started out with about 7 000 in September the account peaked a little over ninety thousand dollars by April of 2020. for those that have the detectors going off that's smart that's not to say that this didn't happen but that is a insane return how insane of a return well let's take a look from September 2019 to April 2020 that represents a 1185.71 return or an 8 000 annualized return that's what this person did now they probably were saving adding money to the account but right out of the gate we have this crazy ex expectation that's now been set after a very short time frame this is a blink of an eye in the time frame of trading okay so now let's take a look at what happened subsequently we see fast

text: account but right out of the gate we have this crazy ex expectation that's now been set after a very short time frame this is a blink of an eye in the time frame of trading okay so now let's take a look at what happened subsequently we see fast forward to July and I'm down to four hundred dollars that represents a negative 99.56 percent return on their money so recap they went from seven thousand to ninety thousand down to four hundred there is so much you can learn from this it's not funny let's take a look at a couple of these things the first one it says over the past Day and weekend I've been sick mentally feel like throwing up I want to know how I can cope with these losses mentally although my initial principle is money I was willing to lose the idea of getting out of the game and the fact that I lost 99 of my portfolio is hard to swallow all right let's talk about it the very first thing I see here obviously is a insanely emotional human being in general this is not good not even just in trading but in life if you go through these emotional roller coasters one you gain nothing from it two you detract your ability to think rationally and make good decisions three you go through this awful cycle and there's no benefit from going through this kind of emotional cycle now

text: trading but in life if you go through these emotional roller coasters one you gain nothing from it two you detract your ability to think rationally and make good decisions three you go through this awful cycle and there's no benefit from going through this kind of emotional cycle now to be clear I'm not saying don't have emotions we all have emotions it's ignorant to think that you could just ah whatever I don't have emotions anymore you do but you can acknowledge the emotions like this person is trying to how can I cope with these losses mentally so they're trying to they're just really late to the punch they're waiting until it's super painful and now they're trying to figure out how to cope emotionally so right out of the gate I can see a contradiction in what they said my initial principle is money I was willing to lose then they're saying the fact that I lost 99 of my portfolio is hard to swallow this is a contradiction inherently so here's the deal it is okay the reason why it's okay is because guess what we we say things all the time that we think at the time we mean but then when it happens we don't mean humans are notorious for that kind of behavior so this is where actually visualizing how you think you will feel and actually putting yourself in the scenario and saying to yourself genuinely what do I think because

text: resolutioners oh this year is different I'm gonna be fit I'm gonna go to the gym I'm gonna clean up my diet humans say all sorts of in the moment in the comfort of that moment that they immediately drop as soon as it becomes slightly difficult you think you're gonna wake up early until the alarm goes off at five and you're like oh well I'll do it tomorrow I don't want to do it today the problem with these kinds of things is you create this insanely slippery slope that then sets you up not even for a trading slash investing failure but a lifetime of this vicious cycle so we need to plan efficiently which I'm going to get into in just a second and then there's greed here's the deal greed is not inherently bad oh what you're not supposed to like greed what do you mean greed's not bad greed is a huge motivating factor I am greedy I have enough money to live comfortably for the rest of my life if I so choose however I still want want more because I want more opportunity it's not just that I want to make more money so that I can be Scrooge McDuck I like having more money because it allows me to also help more people to benefit more businesses by being a patron of them things like that matter a lot so don't inherently dismiss greed is bad now where greed becomes bad

text: money so that I can be Scrooge McDuck I like having more money because it allows me to also help more people to benefit more businesses by being a patron of them things like that matter a lot so don't inherently dismiss greed is bad now where greed becomes bad is when it's oppressive when you make poor decisions because your want of money is so great if my Greed for example was so excessive that I couldn't be happy unless I had a hundred million dollars that is awful greed because then I'm essentially dismissing an entire possibility for a healthy fulfilling life because I don't have this one super greedy metric so you have to figure out what level of greed you have but then you have to be comfortable with the outcome this person had an 8 000 annual return looking at them then they had a 100 drawdown this is what greed gets you in a lot of instances then this guy walks into my office and says those same Banks got greedy they lost track of the market and I can profit off of their stupidity so what I recommend for overcoming greed is again this planning phase which we're going to get into actually right now let's talk about growing from losses learn to lose well what does that mean we walk through a bunch of things from that scenario that can help us understand this idea of losing well but here are some

text: this planning phase which we're going to get into actually right now let's talk about growing from losses learn to lose well what does that mean we walk through a bunch of things from that scenario that can help us understand this idea of losing well but here are some questions to help you with this idea of losing well how do you feel after that losing trade losing week losing month again bear yourself to yourself all of this is useless unless you are honest if you feel some type of way that's telling you something if you genuinely do not feel perturbed in any way that's where we want to be if you have winning trades you should not be elated you should not be ecstatic it just means you're going to be emotional to the other degree we want to be even keel that is a much better way to live your life then as part of losing well is we have an opportunity to see how this fits into our system so if we have this losing trade we get to ask ourselves some more questions like did I maintain proper sizing did I manage the trade according to my plan again going back to this Comfort seeking side of our mind there's a lot of times when we have a trade plan that's written out that's logical that makes sense that we then immediately want to violate because of all of these emotional forces sometimes

text: trade according to my plan again going back to this Comfort seeking side of our mind there's a lot of times when we have a trade plan that's written out that's logical that makes sense that we then immediately want to violate because of all of these emotional forces sometimes even if you don't fully believe in your trading plan as long as it involves managing risk you are far better off managing the risk following the trading plan than updating the trading plan as needed because if you start to allow yourself to violate your trading plan too early one it's useless two you are opening up again this very slippery psychological slope that is very difficult to reel back in later down on the line so did you manage it correctly not only pertaining to did you follow your management plan but did you as the operator behind the keyboard do the right steps that matters almost equally as much as the actual Edge development side of the strategy how does this losing trade fit into the broader strategy performance guess what any strategy is going to have losing trades we should be able to assess each of those losing trades and say yes I expected this this is within the risk control parameters that I set I said I'm going to have an eight percent stop loss it's time for me to get out done and done if you had a trade where you said I had

text: those losing trades and say yes I expected this this is within the risk control parameters that I set I said I'm going to have an eight percent stop loss it's time for me to get out done and done if you had a trade where you said I had an eight percent stop loss but the loss is way bigger than I thought it was that tells us something we need to make some adjustments which leads us into optimization this is where we get to feed the cycle of information so if we look at the performance of the strategy by itself and then the portfolio are you happy with it are you satisfied with your performance as as the trader is there anything you missed that led to a losing trade for example if you were selling premium and then earnings popped up that you didn't know about you missed something that means you could have done something better you need to integrate something else into your process are there new ideas that I want to test as a result of this loss the name of the game here is looking at your process as a Trader as feeding a system that we want to optimize over the long run we're not looking at each individual losing circumstance as the end-all be all because it's not unless you have awful risk control metrics you have to control risk first and foremost you can't invest no money so

text: as feeding a system that we want to optimize over the long run we're not looking at each individual losing circumstance as the end-all be all because it's not unless you have awful risk control metrics you have to control risk first and foremost you can't invest no money so risk control has to come first but beyond that every single data point you get to collect from both winning and losing trades allows you to optimize with the correct mindset remember the obstacle is the way losing trades are difficult for our ego we don't want to look at them we want to exhibit the disposition effect where we cut winning trades too quickly let losing trades run too long but all of that is an opportunity for you to get better as a Trader and optimize your system if there's anything that I left out here don't forget to throw it in the comments or share what your favorite one is like subscribe be an outlier I'll see you guys later
